content:
The reagent 1,2-phenylenediacetic acid was purchased from ACROS Co. 3-Aminopyridine, pyridine, tripenylphosphite, and mercury­(II) halide salts were purchased from Alfa Aesar Co.

Synthesis of <bold>L</bold>

3-Aminopyridine (1.88 g, 20 mmol) solution in 10 mL of pyridine was mixed with 25 mL of pyridine solution of 1,2-phenyldiacetic acid (1.94 g, 10 mmol) and was made a homogeneous mixture by stirring for 20 min. Triphenyl phosphite (6.2 g, 20 mmol) was added and stirred gently for 2 h. The mixture was then refluxed for 24 h. After air cooling to room temperature, it was washed with deionized water several times to get a pure form of L. Yield: 2.95 g (85%). Anal. calcd for C20H18N4O2 (MW = 346.38): C, 69.34; N, 16.17; H, 5.23%. Found: C, 70.27; N, 15.9; H, 4.55%. 1H NMR (DMSO-d 6, δ): 10.38­(s, 2H); 8.72­(d, 2H); 8.23­(d, 2H); 7.99 (d, 2H); 7.29–7.33­(m, 4H); 7.23–7.21­(m, 2H); 3.83 (s, 4H); Figure S1. IR (KBr disk, cm–1): 3309­(w), 3253­(w), 3226­(m), 3172­(m), 3114­(m), 3069­(w), 2979­(m), 2860­(m), 1694­(m), 1669(s), 1607(s), 1553(s), 1483(s), 1411­(m), 1353­(m), 1288­(m), 1240­(m), 1213­(m), 1188­(m), 1147­(m), 1104­(w), 1048­(w), 1027­(w), 957­(w), 885­(w), 805­(m), 753­(m), 718­(m), 700­(m), 625­(w), 578­(w), 543­(w); Figure S2.

Synthesis of [Hg­(<bold>L</bold>)­Cl<sub>2</sub>]<sub> <italic>n</italic> </sub>, <bold>1</bold>

Mercury­(II) chloride (0.027 g, 0.10 mmol), L (0.035 g. 0.10 mmol) and 7 mL of ethanol were sealed in a 23 mL Teflon-lined stainless steel autoclave, which was then heated under autogenous pressure at 120 °C for 48 h followed by slow cooling at a rate of 2 °C h–1 to RT. Slow cooling of the reaction system afforded needle shape colorless crystals suitable for single-crystal X-ray diffraction. Yield: 0.037 g (60%). Anal. calcd for 1, C20H18Cl2HgN4O2 (MW = 617.87): C, 38.87; N, 9.06; H, 2.94%. Found: C, 38.26; N, 8.86; H, 2.94%. IR (cm–1): 3343(s), 3182­(m), 3123­(m), 3070(s), 3045­(m), 2916­(m), 2360­(m), 1706(s), 1664(s), 1598(s), 1585(s), 1537(s), 1482(s), 1455(s), 1426(s), 1411(s), 1363(s), 1344(s), 1324(s), 12969s), 1280(s), 1244(s), 1210(s), 1196(s), 1185(s), 1166(s), 1124(s), 1102(s), 1048(s), 1026­(m), 971­(m), 958­(m), 939­(m), 919­(m), 861­(m), 806(s), 758(s), 732­(m), 401(s), 634­(m), 620­(m), 570­(m), 554­(m), 492­(w), 458­(w), 420­(w).

An alternative method for 1: A 20 mL ethanoic solution of L (0.069 g, 0.20 mmol) was prepared and a 20 mL of ethereal solution of HgCl2 (0.054 g, 0.20 mmol) was layered down slowly without disturbance on top. After 3 weeks, needle-shaped colorless crystals of 1 were generated. Yield: 0.094 g (76%). The structure of this product obtained by layering was verified by using powder X-ray pattern as the one prepared by using a solvothermal reaction, Figure S3.

Synthesis of [Hg­(<bold>L</bold>)­Br<sub>2</sub>]<sub> <italic>n</italic> </sub>, <bold>2</bold>

Prepared as described for 1, except that HgBr2 (0.036 g, 0.10 mmol) and L (0.035 g. 0.10 mmol) were used. Yield: 0.037 g (52%). Anal. calcd for C20H18Br2HgN4O2 (MW = 706.77): C, 33.99; N, 7.93; H, 2.57%. Found: C, 34.17; N, 7.99; H, 2.6%. IR (cm–1): 3452(s), 3438(s), 3349(s), 3239(s), 3115(s), 3066(s), 2915(s), 1960­(w), 1916­(w), 1822­(w), 1707(s), 1683(s), 1680(s), 1598(s), 1584(s), 1535(s), 1481(s), 1448(s), 1428(s), 1425(s), 1361(s), 1341(s), 1323(s), 1285(s), 1279(s), 1244(s), 1208(s), 1194(s), 1185(s), 1166(s), 1123(s), 1100(s), 1046(s), 1026(s), 970(s), 958(s), 939­(m), 916­(m), 874­(w), 861­(w), 805(s), 757(s), 730(s), 700(s), 671(s), 632(s), 607(s), 569(s), 552(s), 514­(m), 506­(m), 492­(w), 458­(w), 410­(w).

An alternative method for 2: A 20 mL ethanoic solution of L (0.069 g, 0.20 mmol) was prepared and a 20 mL methanoic solution of HgBr2 (0.072 g, 0.20 mmol) was layered down slowly without disturbance on top. After 3 weeks, needle shape colorless crystals of 2 were generated. Yield: 0.024 g (34%). The structure of this product obtained by layering has been verified by using powder X-ray pattern as the one prepared by using solvothermal reaction, Figure S4.

Synthesis of [Hg­(<bold>L</bold>)­I<sub>2</sub>]<sub> <italic>n</italic> </sub>, <bold>3</bold>

Prepared as described for 1, except that HgI2 (0.045 g, 0.10 mmol) and L (0.035 g, 0.10 mmol) were used. Yield: 0.056 g (70%). Anal. calcd for C20H18HgI2N4O2 (MW = 800.77): C, 29.997; N, 6.997; H, 2.266%. Found: C, 30.348; N, 7.028; H, 2.322%. IR (cm–1): 3356(s), 3237­(m), 3175­(m), 3119­(m), 3055­(m), 2909­(m), 1958­(w), 1915­(w), 1817­(w), 1711(s), 1654(s), 1597­(m), 1582(s), 1535(s), 1481(s), 1455­(m), 1422(s), 1362­(m), 1341­(m), 1322­(m), 1294(s), 1277­(m), 1244­(m), 1208­(m), 1194­(m), 1183­(m), 1166­(m), 1122­(m), 1099­(m), 1045­(m), 1025­(m), 968­(m), 958­(m), 939­(m), 914­(m), 899­(w), 860­(w), 805­(m), 784­(w), 756­(m), 730­(m), 701­(m), 630­(m), 595­(w), 570­(m), 559­(m), 551­(m), 513­(w), 492­(w), 457­(w), 410­(w).

Synthesis of [Hg­(<bold>L</bold>)­I<sub>2</sub>.MeOH]<sub> <italic>n</italic> </sub>, <bold>4</bold>

A 20 mL methanoic solution of HgI2 (0.091 g, 0.20 mmol) was prepared and layered on top of a 20 mL of ethanoic solution of L (0.069 g, 0.20 mmol). After 3 weeks, colorless column-shaped crystals of 4 were generated. Yield: 0.11 g (66%). Anal. calcd for C21H22HgI2N4O3 (MW = 832.81): C, 30.29; N, 6.73; H, 2.66%. Found: C, 30.03; N, 6.78; H, 2.61%. IR (cm–1): 3900­(w), 3851­(w), 3836­(w), 3799­(w), 3748­(w), 3733­(w), 3709­(w), 3688­(w), 3647­(w), 3585­(w), 3355­(w), 3242­(m), 3183­(m), 3130­(m), 3101­(m), 3068­(m), 2923­(m), 2350­(w), 1917­(w), 1667(s), 1603(s), 1541(s), 1481(s), 1455­(m), 1415(s), 1341(s), 1325­(m), 1288(s), 1244­(m), 1194­(m), 1180­(m), 1124­(m), 1101­(w), 1051­(m), 1023­(m), 961­(m), 939­(m), 909­(m), 878­(m), 807­(m), 772­(m), 727­(m), 698­(m), 643­(m), 632­(m), 575­(m), 516­(m), 458­(w), 446­(w), 432­(w), 410­(w) .

Synthesis of [Hg­(<bold>L</bold>)­I<sub>2</sub>·MeCN]<sub> <italic>n</italic> </sub>, <bold>5</bold>

A 20 mL acetonitrile solution of HgI2 (0.091 g, 0.20 mmol) was prepared and layered on top of a 20 mL ethanoic solution of L (0.069 g, 0.20 mmol). After 1 week, colorless column-shaped crystals of 5 were generated. Yield: 0.11 g (65%). Anal. calcd for C22H21HgI2N5O2 (MW = 841.83): C, 31.38; N, 8.31; H, 2.51%. Found: C, 31.32; N, 8.20; H, 2.27%. IR (cm–1): 3326­(w), 3237­(w), 3179­(w), 3124­(w), 3062­(w), 2924­(w), 2295­(w), 2262­(w), 1923­(w), 1702­(m), 1660(s), 1604­(m), 1543(s), 1482(s), 1411(s), 1346(s), 1310­(w), 1295­(m), 1244­(w), 1194­(m), 1155­(m), 1122­(w), 1099­(w), 1049­(w), 968­(w), 805­(m), 779­(w), 731­(m), 700­(m), 633­(w), 573­(w), 515­(w), 408­(w).

Materials

The reagent 1,2-phenylenediacetic acid was purchased from ACROS Co. 3-Aminopyridine, pyridine, tripenylphosphite, and mercury(II) halide salts were purchased from Alfa Aesar Co.

Synthesis of L 

3-Aminopyridine (1.88 g, 20 mmol) solution in 10 mL of pyridine was mixed with 25 mL of pyridine solution of 1,2-phenyldiacetic acid (1.94 g, 10 mmol) and was made a homogeneous mixture by stirring for 20 min. Triphenyl phosphite (6.2 g, 20 mmol) was added and stirred gently for 2 h. The mixture was then refluxed for 24 h. After air cooling to room temperature, it was washed with deionized water several times to get a pure form of L. Yield: 2.95 g (85%). Anal. calcd for C20H18N4O2 (MW = 346.38): C, 69.34; N, 16.17; H, 5.23%. Found: C, 70.27; N, 15.9; H, 4.55%. 1H NMR (DMSO-d 6, δ): 10.38(s, 2H); 8.72(d, 2H); 8.23(d, 2H); 7.99 (d, 2H); 7.29-7.33(m, 4H); 7.23-7.21(m, 2H); 3.83 (s, 4H); Figure S1. IR (KBr disk, cm-1): 3309(w), 3253(w), 3226(m), 3172(m), 3114(m), 3069(w), 2979(m), 2860(m), 1694(m), 1669(s), 1607(s), 1553(s), 1483(s), 1411(m), 1353(m), 1288(m), 1240(m), 1213(m), 1188(m), 1147(m), 1104(w), 1048(w), 1027(w), 957(w), 885(w), 805(m), 753(m), 718(m), 700(m), 625(w), 578(w), 543(w); Figure S2.

Slow cooling of the reaction system afforded needle shape colorless crystals suitable for single-crystal X-ray diffraction. Yield: 0.037 g (60%). Anal. calcd for 1, C20H18Cl2HgN4O2 (MW = 617.87): C, 38.87; N, 9.06; H, 2.94%. Found: C, 38.26; N, 8.86; H, 2.94%. After 3 weeks, needle-shaped colorless crystals of 1 were generated. Yield: 0.094 g (76%). The structure of this product obtained by layering was verified by using powder X-ray pattern as the one prepared by using a solvothermal reaction, Figure S3.

Synthesis of [Hg(L)Br2] n , 2

Synthesis of [Hg(L)I2⋅MeCN] n , 5 

A 20 mL acetonitrile solution of HgI2 (0.091 g, 0.20 mmol) was prepared and layered on top of a 20 mL ethanoic solution of L (0.069 g, 0.20 mmol). After 1 week, colorless column-shaped crystals of 5 were generated. Yield: 0.11 g (65%). Anal. calcd for C22H21HgI2N5O2 (MW = 841.83): C, 31.38; N, 8.31; H, 2.51%. Found: C, 31.32; N, 8.20; H, 2.27%.
